document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Dohrniphora Dahl (Diptera: Phoridae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Dohrniphora Dahl (Diptera: Phoridae) from China

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Dohrniphora
Dahl 1898
: 188
. Type species:
D. dohrni Dahl
, by monotype.

Crepidopachys
Enderlein 1912
: 16
. Type species
C. longirostrata Enderlein
, by original designation. Synonymized by
Malloch 1913
: 24
.

Pronomiorpha

: 46
. Type species
P. rostrata Enderlein
, by original designation. Synonymized by

subSubSection.paragraph:
The diagnostic characters of the genus were felicitously described by Kung and Brown ( 2005 ). The distinction between
Dohrniphora
and the closely related genus
Diplonevra
was clearly clarified by
Disney ( 1990 a
, b ).

paragraph.keyLead:
1 . Hind tibia with at least one bristle before apical quarter; abdominal tergite VI uniformly brown; mid tibia with dorsal hair pal- isade extends to 1 / 3 of its length; posterior face of hind femur with 6–8 peg-like bristles..................
papuana Brues
2 . Posterior face of hind femur with a patch of scattered hairs or 1–3 bristle-like hairs near the dorsal edge................. 3
- Posterior face of hind femur without hairs near the dorsal edge................................................. 13
3 . Posterior face of hind femur with 5–20 hairs near the dorsal edge................................................ 4
- Posterior face of hind femur with 1–3 bristle-like hairs just below the dorsal edge................................... 5

4 . Palisade of mid tibia extends to 1 / 3 of its length; hind coxal lobe hemispherical........................
cornuta (Bigot)

- Palisade of mid tibia extends to 1 / 2 of its length; hind coxal lobe triangular................................
leei Disney
5 . Palp inflated, equal to or less than 2 times of its width......................................................... 6

6 . Microtrichia patch of hind femur extends to the outside of the group of peg-like bristles.............
microtrichina
sp. nov.
- Microtrichia patch of hind femur confined mainly below the group of peg-like bristles............................... 7

7 . Hair palisade of mid tibia longer than 1 / 2 of its length; peg-like bristles slender and long, pointed at tips.....
intumescens Liu

- Hair palisade of mid tibia shorter than 1 / 2 of its length; peg-like bristles short, blunt at tips...............
modesta Disney
8 . Peg-like bristles on posterior face of hind femur arranged in a straight row........................................ 9
- Peg-like bristles on posterior face of hind femur arranged in an arc-shaped or a right angle........................... 11

9 . Peg-like bristles of hind femur uniform in length, much thinner, hair-like............................
capillaris
sp. nov.
- Peg-like bristles of hind femur varied in length, of which 2–3 are very long and stout, two time longer than others........ 10

10 . With 4–5 peg-like bristles, of which 2–3 are pointed, larger and closely adjacent.......................
proxima
sp. nov.

- With 3–4 peg-like bristles, of which 2 are very long and blunt on top..............................
longisetalis
sp. nov.

11 . Peg-like bristles of hind femur arranged in an arc-shaped, and the bristles in varying thickness around a microctrichia process........................................................................................
setulipalpis Liu
- Peg-like bristles of hind femur arranged in a right angle...................................................... 12

12 . Posterior face of hind femur with 4–6 peg-like bristles; anterior half of abdominal tergite VI yellow; hind coxal lobe triangular (distributed in South Korea ).....................................................................
leei Disney

- Posterior face of hind femur with 8 peg-like bristles; abdominal tergites uniformly brown; hind coxal lobe hemispherical......................................................................................
.. rectangularis
sp. nov.
- Peg-like bristles arranged in a single row or in a arc-shape.................................................... 17

14 . Posterior face of hind femur with 25–27 peg-like bristles, arranged in a triangle; anterior half of abdominal tergite ∏ yellow; palisade of mid tibia extends to 3 / 4 of its length................................................
triangula
sp. nov.
- Posterior face of hind femur with less than 20 peg-like bristles; abdominal tergites uniformly brown................... 15

15 . Posterior face of hind femur with 7–8 peg-like bristles, more distally with a transverse carina; dorsal hair palisade of mid tibia extends less than 1 / 3 of its length............................................................
carinata
sp. nov.
- Posterior face of hind femur with more than 10 peg-like bristles, without a transverse carina......................... 16

16 . Palisade of mid tibia extends less than 1 / 2 of its length; scutellum with 4 bristles.........................
insulana Liu

- Palisade of mid tibia extends more than 1 / 2 of its length; scutellum with 2 bristles and 2 hairs............
cespitula
sp. nov.
- Peg-like bristles arranged in a arc-shaped or an irregular single row............................................. 22

18 . Posterior face of hind femur with 9 peg-like bristles, which are short and blunt and arranged distantly to each other..............................................................................................
infrequens
sp. nov.
- Posterior face of hind femur with less than 8 peg-like bristles, without characters above............................. 19

19 . With 4–5 peg-like bristles, which are blunt on top..................................................
caini Disney

20 . Without microtrichia patch below the group of peg-like bristles of posterior face of hind femur; peg-like bristles relatively long.......................................................................................
aspinula
sp. nov.
- With normal microtrichia patch below the group of peg-like bristles of posterior face of hind femur................... 21

21 . Abdominal tergites ffl – v uniformly brown; hind coxal lobe with short teeth-like spines.............
.. dentiretusa
sp. nov.

- Abdominal tergites ffl – v yellow at anterior half; hind coxal lobe with fine hairs.....................
malaysiae Green

22 . Palisade of mid tibia extends to 1 / 3 of its length; posterior face of hind femur with 3–5 thin, equal length peg-like bristles; lumen of fork of vein Rs much wider.....................................................
belyaevae Mostovski
23 . Peg-like bristles of hind femur arranged in an irregular single row.............................................. 24
- Peg-like bristles of hind femur arranged in an arc-shaped row.................................................. 25

24 . Posterior face of hind femur with about 12 peg-like bristles; microtrichia patch is restricted below the group of peg-like bristles................................................................................
densilinearis Yang et Liu.

- Posterior face of hind femur with about 8 peg-like bristles; microtrichia patch extends above group of peg-like bristles.............................................................................................
separata
sp. nov.
25 . Microtrichia patch of hind femur extends to the outside of the group of peg-like bristles............................. 26
- Microtrichia patch of hind femur restricted below the group of peg-like bristles................................... 27

26 . Palp inflated, length less than 2 times of its width.................................................
dilatata
sp. nov

- Palp normal, length more than 2 times of its width...........................................
prescherweberae Liu

27 . Abdominal tergites uniformly brown; posterior face of hind femur with 4–5 peg-like bristles; ventral margin of hind femur with a small process...........................................................................
qinnica Liu

28 . Ventral margin of base of hind femur with a distinctly concave region; hind coxal lobe with short teeth-like spines.............................................................................................. ..
dentiretusa
sp. nov.

- Ventral margin of base of hind femur without a concave region; hind coxal lobe with fine hairs.........
disparilis
sp. nov.
